definition: to sound sb out/to find out by tactful indirect questioning

to cover/to encase/cover/sheath/to overlap/to interleave/to model after/to copy/formula/harness/loop of rope/(fig.) to fish for/to obtain slyly/classifier for sets, collections/bend (of a river or mountain range, in place names)/tau (Greek letter Ττ)

sentences.english: On the plane, Mandy continues to grill Martin flirtatiously.
sentences.chinese: 在飞机上，曼迪继续与马丁调情，并套问他一些情况。

definition: to make inquiries/to try to find out/to pry
to make insinuations/to take an indirect approach (in making inquiries) (idiom)
to question intensely/to interrogate/to demand information
to sound out opinions/to get sb's views by polite or indirect questioning
to ask about/to make some inquiries/to ask around
to try to gain sb's friendship
polite phrase/conventional greetings/cliché/to try to worm facts out of sb
to try to form friendly ties with sb for one's own benefit/to suck up to sb
see 拐彎抹角|拐弯抹角[guai3 wan1 mo4 jiao3]
